title: Proud Boys
deleted: In late November 2018, it was reported the [[FBI]] had classified the Proud Boys as an extremist group with ties to [[white nationalism]].<ref name="Gdn20181119" /><ref name=oregonian/> Two weeks later, an FBI official briefing [[Clark County, Washington]] law enforcement officials on the group, denied that it was their intent to classify the entire group in this manner and ascribed the mistake to a misunderstanding. During the briefing, FBI agents suggested using websites for more information, including the SPLC resource.<ref name=oregonian>{{Cite web|url=https://www.oregonlive.com/crime/2018/12/head-of-oregons-fbi-bureau-doesnt-designate-proud-boys-as-extremist-group.html|title=Head of Oregon's FBI: Bureau doesn't designate Proud Boys as extremist group|website=oregonlive.com|language=en-US|access-date=December 8, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2018/12/08/fbi-says-proud-boys-are-not-an-extremist-group-after-all/|title=The FBI says the Proud Boys are not an extremist group after all|last=McMillan|first=Keith|date=December 7, 2018|work=The Washington Post|access-date=December 8, 2018|last2=Rosenberg|first2=Eli}}</ref> The official said that their intent was to characterize the possible threat from certain members of the group.<ref name= barnes/>

title: Proud Boys
added: ==== MAGA hats ====

Members of the Proud Boys are also identifiable by their red [[Make America Great Again|MAGA hats]] which they frequently wear along with the Fred Perry black polo shirts.<ref>{{Cite news|last=Belam|first=Martin|last2=Gabbatt|first2=Adam|date=2020-09-30|title=Proud Boys: who are the far-right group that backs Donald Trump?|language=en-GB|work=The Guardian|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/sep/30/proud-boys-who-are-far-right-group-that-backs-donald-trump|url-status=live|access-date=2020-10-01|issn=0261-3077}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Raja|first=Tasneem|date=October 2017|others=Illustrated by Julia Rothman|title=Decoding the Language of Extremist Clothing|url=https://www.topic.com/decoding-the-language-of-extremist-clothing|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2020-10-01|website=Topic|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title=White, male and millennial: Hate groups tap bro culture to recruit members|url=https://publicintegrity.org/politics/white-male-and-millennial-hate-groups-tap-bro-culture-to-recruit-members/|access-date=2020-10-01|website=Center for Public Integrity|language=en-us}}</ref><ref name=":3" />

title: Proud Boys
added: InJanuary2020,theProud Boys attended a large [[Second Amendment to the United States Constitution|SecondAmendment]] rally in Richmond, Virginia. They are opposed to [[Black Lives Matter]] protests and see attempts to [[List of monuments and memorials removed during the George Floyd protests|remove statues of Confederate leaders and other historical figures]] as a "left-wing plot to destroy American history".<ref name=":3"/> Facebook officials reported that on May 30, internal systems flagged activity from Proud Boys-related accounts encouraging "armed agitators" to attend protests following the [[killing of George Floyd]].<ref name="June 2020 Facebook"/>In June 2020, membersof the Proud Boys rallied at the [[Capitol Hill Autonomous Zone]] in Seattle, Washington, in an effort to confront protesters.<ref name=":3">{{cite web|last1=Sardarizadeh|first1=Shayan|last2=Wendling|first2=Mike|date=17 June 2020|title=Who are Boogaloo Bois, antifa and Proud Boys?|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/blogs-trending-53018201|url-status=live|access-date=18 June 2020|website=[[BBC News]]}}</ref>

title: Proud Boys
added: * [[White nationalism]]

title: Proud Boys
added: Texas-based Proud Boys member Alan Swinney was arrested on September 30, 2020 and held in Oregon on "multiple assault charges, pointing a firearm at another, unlawful use of a weapon and unlawful use of tear gas, stun gun or mace."<ref>{{Cite web|last=Wilson|first=Conrad|date=September 30, 2020|title=Police arrest far-right protester who pointed gun at Portland rally|url=https://www.opb.org/article/2020/09/30/police-arrest-far-right-protester-who-pointed-gun-at-portland-rally/?fbclid=IwAR3IgXTn7TBaS0tas1CVu--sM8KobJACTVusIahCt21r0V1SRQ89sTe3KMA|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2020-10-01|website=OPB}}</ref>  Swinney had been recorded firing airsoft pellets at protesters and journalists, and at one point brandished a revolver at his opponents during a Portland, Oregon protest in August 2020.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Wilson|first=Jason|date=2020-09-03|title=Breadth of rightwing Portland protest network reveals energized Trump base|url=http://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2020/sep/03/how-the-rightwing-portland-protest-organizers-represent|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2020-10-01|website=The Guardian|language=en}}</ref>

added: Members of the Proud Boys can be identified by their use of black and yellow Fred Perry shirts, American flags, Make America Great Again hats and military armor including guns.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Greig|first=Finlay|date=September 30, 2020|title=Proud Boys: ‘Western chauvinist’ far-right group explained - and their reaction to Trump’s statement ‘Stand back and stand by’|url=https://www.scotsman.com/news/world/proud-boys-western-chauvinist-far-right-group-explained-and-their-reaction-trumps-statement-stand-back-and-stand-2988105|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2020-10-02|website=The Scotsman|language=en}}</ref>

title: Proud Boys
added: ==== Say No to Marxism ====

On August 5, 2018, a Say No to Marxism rally in San Francisco organized by the Proud Boys and their allies resulted in their outnumbering by counter-protests.<ref name="Wilson 2020">{{Cite web|date=2020-10-01|title=Proud Boys are a dangerous 'white supremacist' group say US agencies|url=http://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/oct/01/proud-boys-white-supremacist-group-law-enforcement-agencies|access-date=2020-10-06|website=the Guardian|language=en}}</ref>

title: Proud Boys
deleted: "our wikipedia page is edited by antifa", Enrique Tarrio. 13 october 2020.

title: Proud Boys
added: ==== Reclamation of #ProudBoys on social media ====

In early October 2020, a campaign from the [[LGBT community]] on Twitter, seemingly started by actor [[George Takei]], was launched to 'reclaim' the [[hashtag]] #proudboys from hate and bigotry, to inclusion and joy.<ref>{{cite news|last=Yo|first=Patricia|date=4 October 2020|title=Gay Men Take Over Proud Boys Hashtag With Photos Of Queer Love|work=[[The Daily Beast]]|url=https://www.thedailybeast.com/gay-men-take-over-proud-boys-hashtag-with-photos-of-queer-love|url-status=live|access-date=5 October 2020}}</ref><ref name=":11">{{Cite news|last=Rosenblatt|first=Kalhan|date=5 October 2020|title=Gay Twitter users flood #ProudBoys hashtag with LGBTQ pride images|work=[[NBC News]]|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/feature/nbc-out/twitter-users-flood-proudboys-hashtag-gay-pride-images-n1242101?cid=sm_npd_nn_tw_ma&fbclid=IwAR3iFfimOtkLIvqVEG4aa1OeuI_hQebEbc8tpxdWfbPG6sGrjrISpmT7woo|url-status=live|access-date=6 October 2020}}</ref> The hashtag was previously used by the group to identify bigoted content, but it begun to be taken over by positive messages celebrating LGBT families and communities, with photos of gay friends, families and [[Internet meme|memes]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Strapagiel|first=Lauren|date=4 October 2020|title=The "Proud Boys" Hashtag Has Been Taken Over By Gay Love|work=[[BuzzFeed News]]|url=https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/laurenstrapagiel/proud-boys-hashtag-reclaimed-gay-love-photos|url-status=live|accessdate=5 October 2020}}</ref>

Reception to the take over has largely been positive, with the hashtag trending on October 4. Tweets from prominent figures such as journalist Jane Lytvynenko and Florida Representative [[Carlos Guillermo Smith]] have greeted the campaign, with Takei tweeting that "our community and allies answered hate with love."<ref name=":8" /><ref name="Forbes #proudboys">{{Cite news|last=Brown|first=Abram|date=4 October 2020|title=The Proud Boys Are Furious That Gay Men Have Taken Over #ProudBoys On Twitter|work=[[Forbes]]|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/abrambrown/2020/10/04/the-proud-boys-are-furious-that-gay-men-have-taken-over-proudboys-on-twitter/#316e4ae12aaf|url-status=live|access-date=6 October 2020}}</ref> The [[Canadian Armed Forces]] in the United States also tweeted out support, with a picture of [[Corporal]] Brent Kenny kissing another man, with the [[Royal Canadian Navy]] and the account for [[HMCS Winnipeg (FFH 338)|HMCS Winnipeg]] (that Kenny sailed on) retweeting.<ref name="Forbes #proudboys" /> In a later tweet, the Canadian Armed Forces in the United States posted: "If you wear our uniform, know what it means. If you're thinking about wearing our uniform, know what it means. Love is love."<ref name=":11" />

In response to the tweets, Proud Boys leader Tarrio officially commented that it was hysterical and that "this isn't something that's offensive to us. It's not an insult. We aren't homophobic. We don't care who people sleep with. People think it's going to bother us. It doesn't."<ref name=":8">{{cite news|title=Gay men have taken over the Proud Boys Twitter hashtag|url=https://lite.cnn.com/en/article/h_cc7024535acb2ef3b8abbf7409e0781f|date=October 4, 2020|accessdate=October 5, 2020|publisher=[[CNN]]}}</ref> On largely-conservative social media app [[Parler]], messages posted by members contained chiefly hateful comments such as "fags, can't stand gay people...should be illegal." ''[[Forbes]]'' has also reported Tarrio had posted opposing comments on Parler, describing how he believes "the left was attempting to turn the group's name into 'a slur' and that the gay pride campaign with #proudboys was an attempt 'to drown out the voices of our supporters.'"<ref name="Forbes #proudboys" />
